pcanvas.geom
Class GeomUtils

java.lang.Object
  pcanvas.geom.GeomUtils

public class GeomUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Geometric utility functions for Points and Vectors.

VectorTurnedLeft

public static Vector VectorTurnedLeft(Vector vector)
"Turns the vector left". This isn't exactly a proper function, as left and right rotations are much more complex when there is a z-component to the vector. For 3D vector "turning" (rotations), see PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float) and use two points to act as the vector needing to be turned.

Parameters:
vector - the vector to "turn left".
Returns:
a vector "turned left".

the distance between start and end.

                                        Point lineStart,
                                        Point lineEnd)
Returns the distance between a point and a line-segment defined by two points..

Parameters:
point - the point.
lineStart - beginning of a line-segment.
lineEnd - end of a line-segment.
Returns:
the distance from point to the line defined by lineStart and lineEnd.

PointRotate

public static Point PointRotate(Point origin,
                                Point toRotate,
                                float angle)
Rotates a point about another point. This is primarily only useful for 2D point rotations.

For 3D rotations, see PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float).

Parameters:
origin - a point to rotate about.
toRotate - the point to rotate.
angle - an angle of rotation, in radians.
Returns:
the rotated point.

Parameters:

Returns:
the rotated point.

PointRotate3D

public static Point PointRotate3D(Point origin,
                                  Point toRotate,
                                  Vector rotationAxis,
                                  float angle)
Performs a point rotation about an arbitrary axis. Unfortunately this does not use quaternions, so deal with it. =)

Parameters:
origin - an origin point.
toRotate - the point to rotate.
rotationAxis - the axis of rotation.
angle - an angle of rotation, in radians.
Returns:
a rotated point.

PointRotate3D

public static Point PointRotate3D(Point point,
                                  GeomUtils.UnitVectors axis,
                                  float angle)
Rotates a point about a GeomUtils.UnitVectors axis. Almost identical to VectorRotate3D(Vector, UnitVectors, float) except we're using points instead of vectors.

Parameters:
point - the point to rotate.
axis - the unit vector to rotate about.
angle - the angle of rotation in radians.
Returns:
the rotated vector.

PointOfIntersection

public static Point PointOfIntersection(Point startA,
                                        Point endA,
                                        Point startB,
                                        Point endB)
Returns the point of intersection of a two line-segments defined by four points. Currently this only works for 2D points.

Parameters:
startA - beginning of the first line-segment.
endA - end of the first line-segment.
startB - beginning of the second line-segment.
endB - end of the second line-segment.
Returns:
their point of intersection.

                                              Point lineStart,
                                              Point lineEnd)
Checks if a provided point is left of a line-segment defined by two other points.

Parameters:
point - the point in question.
lineStart - start of the line.
lineEnd - end of the line.
Returns:
true if the point is "left" of the line, else false.

PointIsLeftOfWithError

public static java.lang.Boolean PointIsLeftOfWithError(Point point,
                                                       Point lineStart,
                                                       Point lineEnd,
                                                       float error)
Checks if a provided point is left of a line-segment defined by two other points, within some provided range of error.

Parameters:
point - the point in question.
lineStart - start of the line.
lineEnd - end of the line.
error - the error the point can be within.
Returns:
true if the point is "left" of the line, else false.

                                              Point center,
                                              float radius)
Checks if a point is inside a circle defined by another point and a radius.

Parameters:
point - the point in question.
center - the center of a circle.
radius - the radius of the circle.
Returns:
true if the point is inside, else false.

PointInTriangle

                                                Point A,
                                                Point B,
                                                Point C)
Checks to see if a point is inside a triangle defined by three separate points.

Parameters:
point - the point in question.
A - triangle vertex.
B - triangle vertex.
C - triangle vertex.
Returns:
true if the point is inside the bounds of the triangle, else false.

AngleOfVector

public static float AngleOfVector(Vector vector)
Returns the 'angle' of a vector. This only really make sense in 2-dimensions.

Parameters:
vector - the vector we need the angle of.
Returns:
the angle of the vector, in radians.

ComputeArc2D

public static Point[] ComputeArc2D(Point center,
                                   Point leftBound,
                                   Point rightBound,
                                   java.lang.Integer precision)

ComputeCirclesBetween

public static java.util.List<Circle3D> ComputeCirclesBetween(java.util.List<Point> topPoints,
                                                             java.util.List<Point> bottomPoints)
Given two sets of uniform points (here called 'top' and 'bottom', but they could be in any orientation to each other), this function will return a List of Circle3D objects which represent a circular 'skeleton' based on the given points.

Parameters:
topPoints - the first set of points.
bottomPoints - the second set of points
Returns:
a list of Circle3D objects based on the given uniform point sets.

printMatrix

private static void printMatrix(Jama.Matrix m)
Internal utility function used for debugging purposes. Prints a Matrix in a nice, neat looking text format.

Parameters:
m - the Matrix to print.
